description: Moon River Brewing Company, the building is said to be haunted by angry spirits. Among them is a lady in white and James Stark, a known gambler who was killed in the building in an altercation.
Pioneer Park, haunted by the ghost of Harriet Webber, wife of the builder of the park.
Monte Vista Hotel, a phantom bellboy is said to knock on the door of room 210 and announce room service.
Henry Levy House, the house is filmed with a locked door flying open and is believed to be the ghosts of previous owners Henry and Camille Levy who died in the house.
Pedro Benedit Horruytiner house, the ghost of Pedro Benedit and a cat who once lived there haunt the house.
Hull House, the wife of Charles Hull the original owner is said to haunt the attic of the house.
Chesapeake and Ohio Canal, haunted by the ghosts of soldiers who fought in the Civil War.
Landmark Inn, a room is haunted by a librarian who lost her lover in a shipwreck.
1st Avenue, haunted by a woman who died during World War II.
Emlen Physick Estate, haunted by the original owner and his family.
New York State Capitol building, haunted by the ghosts of a night watchman who died in a 1911 fire.
Sandford House, haunted by the lady in the black who recently has been sighted by members of the womans club of Fayetteville.
Cincinnati Music Hall, haunted by ghosts as early as 1876 and bones of people were found during an installation of an elevator shaft in 1988.
Pittock Mansion, a mansion overlooking the city is said to be haunted by the original owner and his family.
Cliveden Manor, also known as the Chew House, is said to be haunted by the owners, the Chew family.
Driskill Hotel, is said to be haunted by numerous ghosts including a child who died after a tragic accident in the hotel.
Alfred McCune Home, said to be haunted by the original owners of the home.
Ye College Inn, is said to be haunted by howard a beer-drinking ghost who habitually wears a tan trench coat.
